ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken?
What is your overall assessment of this course?
Do you expect to use this class for credit toward your major, or toward a pre-professional program?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize ECON 110 05 for a fellow student? Would you recommend ECON 110 05 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: It's a faster pace than L1, but I enjoyed the class much more. It was a lot of fun, and I would definitely recommend it!

Taking Portuguese at Yale was the best academic decision I made. I say that even though my major is not in Portuguese. We each have our individual reasons for taking a language, but trust that the department at Yale is fantastic. My professor in particular made it great fun, and I feel like I've emerged out of L2 with respectable proficiency. I can now hold basic conversations and even write emails in Portuguese. Seriously, take Portuguese. It's not as easy as I thought it would be (I had no background whatsoever in Spanish), but I've seriously enjoyed L1 and L2 so much this year.
The class is not very challenging, and not that different from L1. I would recommend it to someone who needs a language credit, because it seems to be less intensive than other L1 language options.
